content.explanation:
Functions are fundamental to technology and programming. In apps and websites, functions process inputs to produce outputs in predictable ways.

For example:
- A music streaming app uses functions to recommend songs based on your listening history
- Social media algorithms use functions to determine what content appears in your feed
- Navigation apps use functions to calculate the fastest route based on current traffic conditions
content.example: When you use a photo filter app, you're applying a function to the original image (input) to produce a modified image (output). Different filters are different functions that transform the image in specific ways.
content.key_point: Understanding functions helps us make sense of the digital world. Every time you interact with technology, you're likely providing inputs to functions that determine what you experience.
